intro: Jacobaea litvinovii, commonly known as the Litvinov's ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
